name: mailparam
description:
Can either attach a file or add a header to a message. It is nested within a cfmail tag. You can
use more than one cfmailparam tag within a cfmail tag.

params.name: file
params.description:
Attaches the specified file to the message. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the
name attribute.

params.name: filename
params.description: file name used for the file attached with the attribute "file", if not set the name of the file itself is used.

params.name: name
params.description:
Specifies the name of the header. Header names are case insensitive. This attribute is mutually
exclusive with the file attribute.

params.name: value
params.description: Indicates the value of the header.

params.name: type
params.description: The MIME media type of the part.

params.name: disposition
params.description:
How the attached file is to be handled. Can be one of the following:

- attachment: presents the file as an attachment.
- inline: displays the file contents in the message.

params.name: contentid
params.description: The Identifier for the attached file. This ID should be globally unique and is used to identify the file in an IMG or other tag in the mail body that references the file content.

params.name: remove
params.description: remove attachment from filesystem after the mail is successfully sent
